title: Manchester City midfielder Rodri reveals he's learned how to make 'tactical fouls'
text:
Manchester City midfielder Rodri has revealed he's learned how to make 'tactical fouls' during his first three months working under Pep Guardiola.

Rodri moved to City in a £62.8 million move from Atletico Madrid in July after impressing Guardiola with his displays last season.

The 23-year-old has operated as a holding midfielder under Guardiola and Rodri says he's had to adapt to a very different set of responsibilities.

Rodri says he's had to adapt to a new midfield role since joining Manchester City in July

Rodri revealed he's added a host of defensive skills to his game, including 'tactical fouls'

The midfielder also admitted title rivals Liverpool are the 'best team in England and Europe'

'I think it's a big challenge for me because I never used to play this position particularly,' he told ESPN FC. 'I didn't have this exact role in the team.

'We have lots of offensive players and many other teams try to counterattack you and a lot of the time you're alone but it's good for me.'

City have often been accused of making deliberate fouls to halt opposition teams in their tracks and Rodri has admitted it is a skill he has acquired under Guardiola.

'I am learning new things, how to go, when to stay, when I have to do a tactical foul, when I have to jump,' he continued.

City beat Liverpool to win the Community Shield but Rodri says the Reds are best in Europe

'It's good for me to learn these things. And for the team it's good because we need those offensive players to be able to play our game.'

City have endured a difficult start to the new Premier League season, with Sunday's defeat to Wolves seeing the club fall eight points behind leaders Liverpool.

Manchester United have long been City's rivals for the Premier League title but Rodri has acknowledged that Liverpool are now their biggest threat.

'The team to beat is Liverpool now and that has been seen the last two seasons,' he added. 'They are the champions of Europe so everyone wants to beat them, not just us.

'They're a great team, they have improved a lot of things, they're a very good team, and they're the best team in England and in Europe.'
description: Manchester City midfielder Rodri has revealed he's learned how to make 'tactical fouls' during his first three months working under Pep Guardiola as he adapts to a holding role in the club's engine room.
